text: India's Nanjarayan Bird Sanctuary, Kazhuveli Bird Sanctuary in Tamil Nadu, and Tawa Reservoir in Madhya Pradesh have been designated as Ramsar sites of international importance. text: Raksha Bandhan, celebrated in August, emphasized the deep bond between siblings. Sisters tied a Rakhi on their brothers' wrists, symbolizing prayers for well-being and a promise of protection. The festival included gift exchanges and family gatherings. Raksha Bandhan's auspicious time, or "Muhurat," varies each year based on the lunar calendar. Generally, the festival is observed when the moon is visible on the full moon day of Shravana (usually in August). For accurate timing, consult a local Hindu calendar or Panchang, as the exact Muhurat can differ by region and year. Celebrating during this time ensures adherence to traditional customs and maximizes the festival’s spiritual significance.

The convention aims to galvanize support in battleground states, with Harris focusing on future-focused themes and the Democratic platform emphasizing progressive values.
title: DNC 2024: Harris and Walz set to accept nominations as Chicago hosts historic convention

text: Professor Muhammad Yunus pledged for free and fair elections in Bangladesh after completing vital reforms. He emphasized the necessity of election commission, judiciary, and administration reforms. Yunus criticised the previous government for rigging elections and suppressing democratic rights. International community's support was sought for creating a poverty-free, democratic Bangladesh while ensuring human rights and accountability.
title: Early Bangladesh polls unlikely as Yunus says implement reforms first

text: Kerala Gramin Bank deducted loan EMIs from emergency relief provided by the state government to survivors of the July 30 Wayanad landslides. The move, deemed 'cruel' by state cooperatives minister VN Vasavan, affected many victims who had planned to use the aid for essential needs. Authorities have now instructed the bank to return the deducted amounts.
title: Bank cuts EMIs from Wayanad survivors' relief aid, sparks row

text: The alleged rape and murder of a woman doctor at RG Kar Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata has sparked widespread outrage and protests across the city.
tags: RG Kar Medical College and Hospital
title: Surya posts strong message in wake of Kolkata horror

text: Raksha Bandhan, celebrated in August, emphasized the deep bond between siblings. Sisters tied a Rakhi on their brothers' wrists, symbolizing prayers for well-being and a promise of protection. The festival included gift exchanges and family gatherings. Raksha Bandhan's auspicious time, or "Muhurat," varies each year based on the lunar calendar. Generally, the festival is observed when the moon is visible on the full moon day of Shravana (usually in August). For accurate timing, consult a local Hindu calendar or Panchang, as the exact Muhurat can differ by region and year. Celebrating during this time ensures adherence to traditional customs and maximizes the festival’s spiritual significance.
title: Raksha Bandhan 2024: What is the shubh muhurat today for tying Rakhi

text: Forest officials were searching for a three-year-old male tiger that migrated 125km from Sariska Reserve in Rajasthan to Rewari's Jhabua forest for the second time in eight months. The tiger, identified as ST-2302, was located via pugmarks. Efforts were ongoing to prevent it from straying into nearby villages and protect the wildlife corridor.
title: For 2nd time this year, male tiger from Sariska travels 125km to Rewari forest

text: Over 70 Padma awardee doctors urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene in ensuring justice for a young doctor raped and murdered in Kolkata. They requested stricter laws and rapid enforcement to protect healthcare professionals, emphasising the need for a law specifically addressing violence against medical staff, which has been pending since 2019.
title: Kolkata rape-murder: 70 Padma awardee docs write to PM, seek intervention

text: A 21-year-old college student was allegedly sexually assaulted by a biker in Bengaluru after she hitched a ride to return home from a party. The biker took her to an isolated spot before her friends rescued her and rushed her to a hospital.
title: B'luru girl returning from party raped by biker who gave her lift

text: Eleven labourers from a Ghaziabad-based firm died on the way to their home for Raksha Bandhan, and 26 were injured when their pick-up truck collided with a bus on the Meerut-Badaun state highway. The collision occurred near Salempur in Bulandshahr, reportedly due to the bus attempting to overtake another vehicle. Critically injured victims were shifted to hospitals, and authorities have initiated assistance measures.
title: 11 UP labourers going home for raksha bandhan die in accident

text: Five men, including three Uttarakhand Transport Corporation employees, were arrested on Sunday for allegedly gang-raping a 16-year-old girl in a bus parked at Dehradun ISBT. The incident, which occurred last Monday, was reported by the girl during a counselling session. Police seized the bus, and the accused confessed during interrogation. Further investigation is underway.
title: Minor gang-raped in bus at Doon ISBT by 5, including 3 govt staffers

text: The NCPCR chairman Priyank Kanoongo criticised Unicef's involvement in creating a "radical curriculum" for Bihar's government-funded madrassas and the use of Pakistan-published books. He raised concerns about Hindu children enrolling in these madrassas and recommended a UN probe and dissolution of the Madrassa Board, calling the curriculum development an act of appeasement.
title: NCPCR chairman flags use of Pak books in Bihar madrassas

text: Indian pacer Khaleel Ahmed, in a conversation with Aakash Chopra, expressed deep admiration for MS Dhoni, calling him his "guru." Khaleel shared heartfelt anecdotes, including Dhoni entrusting him with bowling the first over in the 2018 Asia Cup, fulfilling his childhood dream. He also recalled a memorable moment when Dhoni gifted him flowers during a New Zealand tour. Dhoni's influence as a mentor continues to inspire cricketers, even after his last IPL appearance in 2024.
title: 'Not my friend, not my elder brother...': Khaleel on Dhoni

text: Sion police have filed an FIR against two siblings for allegedly assaulting a female doctor at Sion hospital. The incident occurred when Prasad Devendra, who was reportedly drunk, became abusive and his sister assaulted the doctor during treatment.
title: Woman doctor assaulted by patient, kin at Mumbai hospital

text: Former Jharkhand CM and current minister Champai Soren hinted at leaving the JMM party, citing ridicule and humiliation. Chief minister Hemant Soren accused BJP of trying to poach MLAs by offering money while Congress and JMM members believed it won't affect poll prospects. Champai expressed his dedication to public welfare amid political turmoil.
title: Ahead of Jharkhand poll, Champai Soren hints he's set to quit JMM

text: The Supreme Court took suo motu cognisance of the rape-murder of a doctor at Kolkata's R G Kar hospital on August 9. A bench headed by CJI D Y Chandrachud will initiate proceedings on Tuesday. The SC intervention follows the vandalism incident at the hospital and aims to address the safety of healthcare professionals across India.
title: In rare move, SC takes up Kolkata case, may look at doctors’ safety

text: The North Eastern Council withdrew its Vision 2047 document after Manipur CM N Biren Singh identified an error. The document incorrectly stated the Kuki (Chin) tribe originated from 'Chin State of Manipur.' Chin State is actually in Myanmar, leading to necessary corrections and the withdrawal of the draft document after raising the issue.
title: NEC withdraws 2047 'vision' doc after 'Chin State of Manipur' error

text: Coast Guard director general Rakesh Pal, 59, died of a cardiac arrest in Chennai while preparing for an event with Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. Pal suffered multiple cardiac arrests before reaching Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital, where he underwent emergency procedures. Despite efforts to revive him, Pal passed away. His remains will be taken to New Delhi for the funeral.
title: Coast Guard DG Rakesh Pal dies of heart attack in Chennai

text: An Ahmedabad civil court ruled that names of deities, like 'Shree Ram,' cannot be exclusively owned merely by trademark registration. The court dismissed a clothing shop owner's suit against his cousin using the 'Shree Ram Vastra Bhandar' name, emphasising that it is a generic term and other individuals have the right to use it.
title: No rights over 'Shree Ram' due to trademark: Court

text: Virus research laboratories in India have been asked to prepare for early diagnosis of Monkeypox after a high-level meeting directed at enhanced surveillance. Currently, 32 labs can test for the virus. No cases have been reported in India; however, protocols for prevention and treatment are being widely disseminated.
title: Gear up to diagnose mpox cases early, govt tells top labs

text: Severe thunderstorms hit the Northeast and mid-Atlantic regions on August 18, 2024, with destructive wind gusts, hail, and flash flooding affecting major cities like New York, Philadelphia, and Washington, DC. text: Melania Trump's former friend, Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, who authored the New York Times bestseller Melania and Me: The Rise and Fall of My Friendship with the First Lady alleged that Donald Trump's wife was selling ornaments bearing resemblance to the Presidential Medal of Freedom -- on her site. Stephanie posted photo of the memorabilia on sale on Melania's site and claimed that the former First Lady altered the image of the Medal of Freedom.
title: Melania Trump's ex-bestie hits out at her, calls 'unpatriotic' for this reason
